page.title: 11East Court
page.content: East Court Manor is at present a guest house and is owned by Mr. and Mrs. C.J.Rowland and Mrs.W.Evans. The previous owners were Mr. and Mrs.G.Dyer who ran it as an old people's home. The house was originally built by the Salmon family who were merchants and traders. The grounds extend to four and a half acres and there are two self-catering cottages. The coach house and the stables have been converted into accommodation. The house itself has five reception rooms and eleven bedrooms. An interesting story is connected with the Perkins family who lived at East Court for many years. Colonel Perkins shot himself and his wife shut up the house and lived on her own until finally she was admitted to the Mendip Hospital in l97O.
